connectBankREconcilePage.question: What is bank reconciliation? Why is it done?
connectBankREconcilePage.answer: A bank reconciliation compares the difference between the bank balance on the bank statement with the balance on the accounting records of the company. Sometimes, certain transactions may be accounted for in the bank’s system before it is integrated into the company’s accounting system. Hence, bank reconciliation is done so that such differences can be detected.

connectBankREconcilePage.question: What is reconciliation software?
connectBankREconcilePage.answer: A reconciliation software is a tool that can help you automate and standardise the reconciliation process to ensure quality and accuracy in preparing financial statements. With a bank reconciliation software, it becomes easier for accountants to compare bank, general ledger and other data, verify the correctness of balance sheets as well as identify any discrepancies, attach supporting documentation, etc.

Since the bank’s API is integrated directly within the app, Giddh automatically monitors and categorizes your bank transactions and makes the reconciliation process smoother and smarter.

cloudAccountingSoftware.question: What does cloud accounting mean?
cloudAccountingSoftware.answer: A cloud accounting software isn’t very different from the traditional, locally-hosted software, but it is capable of handling more complex tasks and is hosted on remote servers or the cloud. Here, the data and the software are stored on remote servers instead of the user’s desktop, and the user can access it through the internet via a cloud service provider.

cloudAccountingSoftware.question: How can accounting software help us?
cloudAccountingSoftware.answer: An accounting software can help you carry out financial tasks, such as recording your company expenses, preparing estimates, creating and sending invoices, filing tax returns, keeping a record of profit and loss statements, allocating budgets and making forecasts. It can also be used to automate the manual and repetitive tasks involved in maintaining financial accounts, and save up on significant time and resources.

cloudAccountingSoftware.question: Is my data safe & secure in the cloud accounting system?

All your data is stored on remote servers in an encrypted format. Besides, the best cloud accounting software ensures that critical financial data is not exposed to unauthorised sources and has backup servers to ensure there is zero data loss. With cloud-based accounting software, it is safe and easy to share data as well. You can just grant access rights to the person you want to share your data with.

cloudAccountingSoftware.question: Can I access my accounting data from multiple devices & multiple users at the same time?

Besides, you can set the access permission for each user so that you can control which data can be accessed by a particular user.

cloudAccountingSoftware.list2: The errors that may occur while manually entering the data in offline solutions can be prevented.

cloudAccountingSoftware.list4: Cloud accounting solutions are easier to manage and require less maintenance.

importDataPage.question: What are the three golden rules of accounting?
importDataPage.answer: You need to debit the account when you receive something, and credit the account if you give something. You have to debit the account if something such as an asset comes into your business, and credit the account when something goes out of your business. You have to debit the account if your business has a profit or loss, and credit the account if income or gain needs to be recorded.

financialReportingPage.question: What is financial reporting software?
financialReportingPage.answer: Financial reporting is a crucial part of business accounting functions. A financial reporting software helps a business automate the financial and accounting tasks. The financial reports software is available as a basic single-entry system and complex double-entry solutions. In this competitive business environment, adopting the best financial reporting tools are essential to ensure accuracy in accounting functions, cut down on expenses and boost efficiency. Top financial analysis software like Giddh can help you do that and offer greater visibility of your current financial standing and insights on factors that can impact your profitability.

financialReportingPage.question: What does financial reporting include?
financialReportingPage.answer: The financial reporting process produces statements that present a business’s financial standing to the management, investors as well as the government. It includes the following.
financialReportingPage.list1: Financial statements of income, comprehensive income, cash flows, stockholders’ equities and balance sheet
financialReportingPage.list2: Any financial information available on the enterprise’s website
financialReportingPage.list3: Documents of common stock and securities
financialReportingPage.list4: Communication regarding quarterly earning and other relevant information
financialReportingPage.list5: Quarterly and annual reports to stockholders as well as government agencies and SEC (Securities and Exchange Commission)

financialReportingPage.question: What types of reports are available in Giddh?
financialReportingPage.answer: Giddh’s financial analysis software offers different financial reports to help you understand the financial condition of your business. The four major reports that are necessary to indicate the financial well-being of business are–
financialReportingPage.list1: Balance Sheet: These offer a comparison between the assets against liabilities and equity.
financialReportingPage.list2: Income Statement: These reports are an indication of the income earned in an annual reporting period.
financialReportingPage.list3: Capital Statement: These statements present an estimate of the increase or decrease in the capital accounts of the owner over a certain period.
financialReportingPage.list4: Cash Flows: Cash flows are budgeting tools that are used for making predictions of the cash flow fluctuations in the future by analysing the performance of the past.

financialReportingPage.question: What are the three objectives of financial reporting?
financialReportingPage.answer: Majorly, there are three essential objectives of financial reporting, which are:
financialReportingPage.list1: Inform investors about how efficiently their cash is being utilised and being reinvested in the business.
financialReportingPage.list2: Track the cash flow to determine the source of incoming business finances
financialReportingPage.list3: Offer an analysis of the assets, liabilities and owner’s equity
